author: shanii18
title: great set ! the silver brick is so cool looking .
review: Great set , let me know if you wanna buy it ! I had my fun days with it already, don't mind parting with it, could use the extra cash :( not sure if I have all the parts but I have got the majority, will check the parts individually but that would take me a bit o time. Great set though!

author: meyerc13
title: Good starter set
review:
[img]http://www.bricklink.com/SL/3026-1.jpg?0[/img]

This is an older set, but I found a sealed version of the set a little over a year ago so there are still some out there floating around in people's attics and out of the way toy shops.  If you can't find this set, you can probably finds some of its successors sold as "Basic Bricks" sets.  On to the review:

Pros

  • The best thing about this set is that it comes in a large silver brick box.  The box is even larger than the 6166 Large Brick Box's box (try saying that ten times fast!).  Very useful for storing your LEGOs.
  • This set came with a rare chrome silver brick.  It was only part of five different sets in 1998.  Too bad there was only one included.
  • If you are looking for basic bricks, this set has them.  From 1x1 and 2x2 to 1x8 and 2x6.  The set has 244 bricks in Blue, Red, White, and Yellow.  There are only 120 Black and 104 Green bricks.

Con

  • The first drawback to this set is that it includes nothing but basic bricks.  No doors, windows, plates, wheels - nothing.  If you are into any of the various LEGO themes, this set alone won't be of much use.  However, compared to the more recent Basic Bricks sets like 5576 and 5578, at least this includes a storage tub.

This was a set that deserved a real review, if you can find it in a hole-in-the-wall Toy shop or at a rummage sale, it is worth picking up for the storage tub and large number of basic bricks.
